 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

        main {

        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

                </span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<!----></span><br>use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<span class="line"><!---->use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<!----></span><br>in real chrome I think the trigger step is<span class="line"><!---->in real chrome I think the trigger step is<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>https://xxx.com/xxx.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xxx.com/xxx.html"><!---->https://xxx.com/xxx.html<!----></a> which contains pdf iframe.<span class="line"><!----> which contains pdf iframe.<!----></span><br>2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<span class="line"><!---->2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<!----></span><br>3.chrome send a SequencedTask, and will  let web_contents->OpenURL. Because here we open the pdf. chrome will add the pdf plugin.<span class="line"><!---->3.chrome send a SequencedTask, and will  let web_contents-&gt;OpenURL. Because here we open the pdf. chrome will add the pdf plugin.<!----></span><br>4.we close the whole browser. it will cause profile destroyed, and will trigger uaf.<span class="line"><!---->4.we close the whole browser. it will cause profile destroyed, and will trigger uaf.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300<a         If the UAF can only occur in the patched version then I agree, it should be WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->If the UAF can only occur in the patched version then I agree, it should be WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>I CC'd you to <span class="line"><!---->I CC'd you to <!----></span>crbug.com/1298684<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298684" title="uaf in TypedNavigationUpgradeThrottle::FallbackToHttp"><!---->crbug.com/1298684<!----></a> which is related and I believe should also be WontFix because the patch also uses PostDelayedTask() instead of PostTask(), can you just double check and confirm?<span class="line"><!----> which is related and I believe should also be WontFix because the patch also uses PostDelayedTask() instead of PostTask(), can you just double check and confirm?<!----></span><br><br>I'm happy to close out all three.<span class="line"><!---->I'm happy to close out all three.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM

         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            <div>

        for LitElement.

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">

          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>
          <div class="container-issue">

              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;

    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }

    box-sizing: border-box;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <div class="select-container">
        <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">arrow_drop_down</i>
        <select id="can" name="can" aria-label="Search scope">
          <optgroup label="Search within">
            <option value="1" selected="">All issues</option>
            <option value="2">Open issues</option>

          <optgroup label="My saved queries" hidden="">
            
            <option data-href="/u//queries">
              Manage my saved queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>
        </select>
      </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

url_params in other thread, which may cause uaf in profile destroy.<!----></span><br>2.we can see the similar funtion WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<span class="line"><!---->2.we can see the similar funtion WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> base::SequencedTaskRunnerHandle::Get()->PostTask(<span class="line"><!----> base::SequencedTaskRunnerHandle::Get()-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>                     [](base::WeakPtr<content::WebContents> web_contents,<span class="line"><!---->                     [](base::WeakPtr&lt;content::WebContents&gt; web_contents,<!----></span><br>                        const content::OpenURLParams& params) { // here use params<span class="line"><!---->                        const content::OpenURLParams&amp; params) { // here use params<!----></span><br>                       if (!web_contents)<span class="line"><!---->                       if (!web_contents)<!----></span><br>                         return;<span class="line"><!---->                         return;<!----></span><br>                       web_contents->OpenURL(params);<span class="line"><!---->                       web_contents-&gt;OpenURL(params);<!----></span><br>                     },<span class="line"><!---->                     },<!----></span><br>                     web_contents->GetWeakPtr(), std::move(params)));<span class="line"><!---->                     web_contents-&gt;GetWeakPtr(), std::move(params)));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>3.how to fix?<span class="line"><!---->3.how to fix?<!----></span><br><br>move the content::OpenURLParams Create into the thread callback.<span class="line"><!---->move the content::OpenURLParams Create into the thread callback.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before?         alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I was just looking at the uaf.txt and looking at the destruction sequence...<span class="line"><!---->I was just looking at the uaf.txt and looking at the destruction sequence...<!----></span><br><br>OpenURLParams has a scoped_refptr to SiteInstance. <span class="line"><!---->OpenURLParams has a scoped_refptr to SiteInstance. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><br>but <span class="line"><!---->but <!----></span><br>IsolationContext has a raw ptr (via a union) to BrowsingContext..  From uaf.txt this looks like an order of Profile shutdown issue (but could be an issue with the new destroy profile code).<span class="line"><!---->IsolationContext has a raw ptr (via a union) to BrowsingContext..         Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300<a            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;

        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          }

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 }
 }
 });

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        the step is a little different.<span class="line"><!---->the step is a little different.<!----></span><br>but the bug's concept is the same<span class="line"><!---->but the bug's concept is the same<!----></span><br>1. we need to enter the function WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect to send a SequencedTaskRunnerHandle callback<span class="line"><!---->1. we need to enter the function WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect to send a SequencedTaskRunnerHandle callback<!----></span><br>2. close the whole browser to destroy profile<span class="line"><!---->2. close the whole browser to destroy profile<!----></span><br>3.when the content::OpenURLParams::~OpenURLParams occur. it will enter function<span class="line"><!---->3.when the content::OpenURLParams::~OpenURLParams occur. it will enter function<!----></span><br> search::`anonymous namespace'::NewTabURLDetails::ForProfile  and use the destroyed profile <span class="line"><!----> search::`anonymous namespace'::NewTabURLDetails::ForProfile  and use the destroyed profile <!----></span><br><br>the uaf you can see from <span class="line"><!---->the uaf you can see from <!----></span>crbug.com/1298512#c1<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512#c1" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->crbug.com/1298512#c1<!----></a> asan.txt and steps<span class="line"><!----> asan.txt and steps<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<!----></span><br>use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<span class="line"><!---->use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<!----></span><br>in real chrome I think the trigger step is<span class="line"><!---->in real chrome I think the trigger step is<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>https://xxx.com/xxx.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xxx.com/xxx.html"><!---->https://xxx.com/xxx.html<!----></a> which contains pdf iframe.<span class="line"><!----> which contains pdf iframe.<!----></span><br>2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<span class="line"><!---->2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<!----></span><br>3.chrome send a SequencedTask, and will  let web_contents->OpenURL. Because here we open the pdf. chrome will add the pdf plugin.<span class="line"><!---->3.chrome send a SequencedTask, and will  let web_contents-&gt;OpenURL.         alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1298683#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 22, 2022, 4:00 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3]
