        Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/task/sequenced_task_runner.h;l=71-72;drc=cfa7c8e958243a023ee97ea25951a51d6a089300<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs?         I was just looking at the uaf.txt and looking at the destruction sequence...<span class="line"><!---->I was just looking at the uaf.txt and looking at the destruction sequence...<!----></span><br><br>OpenURLParams has a scoped_refptr to SiteInstance. <span class="line"><!---->OpenURLParams has a scoped_refptr to SiteInstance. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/browser/page_navigator.h;l=96?q=OpenURLParams&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><br>but <span class="line"><!---->but <!----></span><br>IsolationContext has a raw ptr (via a union) to BrowsingContext..         Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a         after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->after my research,  I find that the bug only the influence the url of pdf. maybe it use the plugin of pdf which cause ~SiteInstanceImpl  used after profile destroyed.<!----></span><br>use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<span class="line"><!---->use my patch and rebuild chrome (sorry for my dirty code, I just want to triggr it easier..)<!----></span><br>in real chrome I think the trigger step is<span class="line"><!---->in real chrome I think the trigger step is<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>https://xxx.com/xxx.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xxx.com/xxx.html"><!---->https://xxx.com/xxx.html<!----></a> which contains pdf iframe.<span class="line"><!----> which contains pdf iframe.<!----></span><br>2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<span class="line"><!---->2.the https website has some error which WellKnownChangePasswordNavigationThrottle::Redirect<!----></span><br>3.chrome send a SequencedTask, and will  let web_contents->OpenURL.         alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->alexmos/creis@ can you have a look at these bugs? Seems not that the OpenURLParams is the problem but that SiteInstance is holding onto a BrowsingInstance, which holds onto an IsolationContext, that context has pointer to a BrowsingContext (ProfileImpl) that has been destroyed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Correct, this is the same issue as <span class="line"><!---->Correct, this is the same issue as <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction can't happen with a dangling RenderProcessHost/WebContents. We CHECK() for this, so it's always guaranteed.<!----></span><br>- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<span class="line"><!---->- Profile destruction is triggered when the Profile's refcount hits 0, and runs in a task [1].<!----></span><br>- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<span class="line"><!---->- The code causing this race uses PostTask() in production, and PostDelayedTask() in wxhusst@'s patched version. This is important, as it can affect whether the bug is possible *at all*.<!----></span><br>- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<span class="line"><!---->- SequencedTaskRunner guarantees that non-delayed tasks are run in FIFO order [2].<!----></span><br><br>In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<span class="line"><!---->In real code, the only way for this bug to repro is if the task from [1] is *posted* before the task from [3] is *posted*.<!----></span><br><br>When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<span class="line"><!---->When [1] runs, triggering profile destruction means there's no Browser for that Profile. The code for [3] cannot possibly run in that context, because there's no way to trigger a navigation without a WebContents [3]. (Technically, other objects than Browser can hold a WebContents, but those should all be covered by ScopedProfileKeepAlive anyways. If not, that's a separate bug and a *much* more severe one)<!----></span><br><br>In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<span class="line"><!---->In other words, [3] always runs after [1] in real code. Assuming this is correct, this UAF can *only* happen in the patched version. The repro patch adds a delay; this changes execution order, because of how SequencedTaskRunner works.<!----></span><br><br>I'm tempted to close this (and <span class="line"><!---->I'm tempted to close this (and <!----></span>bug 1298512<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1298512" title="uaf in search::GetNewTabPageURL"><!---->bug 1298512<!----></a>) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<span class="line"><!---->) as WontFix with SecurityImpact-None.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/keep_alive/scoped_profile_keep_alive.cc;l=36-39;drc=16fc7907d792074bbf4ed1b35a95efa050709075<!----></a><br>[2]            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>

      </div>

          </chops-button>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
